DOC.brief_summary: France is a country strong consumer of antibiotics in Europe, specially in primary care. Outpatient antibiotic use represents around 90% of total antibiotic use and prescriptions come mainly from general practitioners. A literature review of antibiotic stewardship in primary care show that there is no evaluation of interest of giving information about consumption of antibiotics and bacterial resistance to general practitioners. The objective of this study is to demonstrate that practitioners implicated in the followed of consumption of antibiotics and bacterial resistance around their geographical area of practice could change and improve their practices in good use of antibiotics.
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy of Information System Regarding the Consumption of Antibiotics and Bacterial Resistance in Primary Care
